title: Developer
body: A Developer is a CloudConnexa user (Owner or Admin) that utilizes CloudConnexa's API to interact with and manage a Wide-area Private Cloud (WPC).

title: Developer
body: CloudConnexaTM, formerly known as OpenVPN Cloud.

title: CloudConnexa API User Guidance (beta)
body: CloudConnexa API User Guidance (beta)

title: Overview
body: CloudConnexa formerly known as OpenVPN Cloud

title: Overview
body: API

title: Overview
body: The beta version of the CloudConnexa API is now available. Use it to develop a portal or application for the administration of your VPN networks, hosts,

title: Overview
body: The beta version of the CloudConnexa API is now available. Use it to develop a portal or application for the administration of your VPN networks, hosts,

title: Overview
body: The beta version of the CloudConnexa API is now available. Use it to develop a portal or application for the administration of your WPC Networks, Hosts, Users, and other core services.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: With the OAuth credentials that you create, you can authenticate to the API endpoint and use the CloudConnexa API.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: You can enable Basic Auth only by request. If you want to use Basic Auth instead of OAuth, contact the CloudConnexa support team at cloud-support@openvpn.net or open a request in the portal at http://support.openvpn.net.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: From the CloudConnexa Administration portal, click the Profile icon and then select My Account.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Click Cloud API (Beta) and then Create Credentials.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Specify a name for your credentials.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Accept the default one-month lifetime value or specify a different one.OAuth credentials have an expiration period of two weeks, one month, six months, or one year.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Specify an optional whitelisted IP subnet range.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Click Create.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Copy the credential key and paste it into a secure file. Also, copy the credential secret and paste it into a secure file.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: Click Back. The Cloud API page lists the credential.

title: Creating OAuth credentials
body: To enable the CloudConnexa API, click the toggle button.

title: API Connection
body: The API endpoint address is unique to your account, as shown below.

title: API Connection
body: <yourOpenVPNID>.api.openvpn.com

title: Viewing JSON calls and responses
body: To access an overview of the core JSON calls and responses available in the CloudConnexa beta API, sign in to your CloudConnexa Owner account and then navigate to the Swagger portal. Use one of the following methods:

title: Viewing JSON calls and responses
body: Use the direct link https://<yourCloudConnexaID>.api.openvpn.com/docs/swagger-ui/#/

title: Viewing JSON calls and responses
body: Click the Cloud API (Beta) tab in My Account and then click the Swagger link.

title: Viewing JSON calls and responses
body: Swagger opens in new tab.

title: Connectors
body: A Connector is an unattended Device with a Connector application installed, which provides connectivity between CloudConnexa and your private Network or private application server.

title: DNS Records
body: A DNS “A” record is an address record in your DNS server that resolves an IPv4 address with a hostname/domain.

title: Devices
body: A Device is a computer, smartphone, or IoT-connected Device with an installed OpenVPN client used to connect to your WPC. Each User can have one or more associated Devices.

title: Hosts
body: A Host represents a server on your private Network running a Connector to provide connectivity to CloudConnexa.

title: Networks
body: A Network is an on-premises or IaaS-hosted range of private IP address subnets that provides access to business-owned resources, secure internet access, Internet Gateway, and more. Each Network requires at least one Connector for Site-to-Site or Point-to-Site WPC connectivity.

title: OAuth
body: OAuth is an open-standard authorization protocol that provides secure, designated access to applications using authorization tokens, which prove your identity to authenticate with the CloudConnexa API.

title: OAuth
body: CloudConnexa uses OAuth 2.0.

title: Users
body: Generally, a User such as an employee, contractor, or other third-party person is authorized to access your WPC. A User can also generate connection profiles for unattended routers or IoT Devices.

title: Users
body: It is possible to create many Users simultaneously.

title: User Groups
body: A User Group allows for the bulk administration of settings such as role- and department-based access controls, available WPC regions, internet access, types of authentication, and more.

title: Access Groups
body: An Access Group defines a specific access control configuration by specifying the access relationship between Sources (i.e. Who?) and Destinations (i.e. What?).

title: Regions
body: A Region is a geographic point-of-presence hosted by CloudConnexa, which consists of a group of high-performance multi-tenant WPC servers. All CloudConnexa regions are interconnected in a Full-Mesh topology to form a high-bandwidth core Network.
